body_html:
officially, we cannot support non-apple tooling, it becomes really hard to give users a consistent experience without that. So, official openmp support is out until Apple includes it in their clang.

If users figure out how to build their own tooling, which enable OpenMP support, I think that we can highlight that in the README somehow.

Saying that, we are moving our core internals away from OpenMP based parallelism and towards Intel TBB based. The transition will take quite some time, but that's the direction we're headed, and hence I'm less worried about the OpenMP story.

officially, we cannot support non-apple tooling, it becomes really hard to give users a consistent experience without that. So, official openmp support is out until Apple includes it in their clang.

If users figure out how to build their own tooling, which enable OpenMP support, I think that we can highlight that in the README somehow.

Saying that, we are moving our core internals away from OpenMP based parallelism and towards Intel TBB based. The transition will take quite some time, but that's the direction we're headed, and hence I'm less worried about the OpenMP story.
